page.title: 02ORIGIN OF PLACE NAME
page.content: In the past the village was often referred to as{"Bentley Green"}rather repeating its name as Bentley means {"grass clearing in the forest".}That being{Alice Holt Forest}now only remaining to the South, and the research headquarters of the{Forestry} {Commission.}The "greens" have largely disappeared but still exist in village names viz.:_ East Green, South Green, Carter's Green and Green Farm. The value of these "greens" as a route through the forest can be judged from the fact that ordinance required the road to be "wide enough for sixteen knights in armour to ride abreast" and yet was still an ideal site for an ambush on wealthy travellers.
